009package com.weather.sdk.exception;
010
011/**
012 * Exception thrown when a city cannot be found by the OpenWeatherAPI.
013 *
014 * <p>This exception is thrown when:
015 *
016 * <ul>
017 *   <li>The specified city name doesn't exist in the OpenWeatherAPI database
018 *   <li>The city name is misspelled or malformed
019 *   <li>The city name is too ambiguous (multiple matches found)
020 *   <li>The city name contains invalid characters
021 *   <li>The city is too small or not covered by OpenWeatherAPI
022 * </ul>
023 *
024 * <h2>Error Code</h2>
025 *
026 * <p>Error code: {@value #CITY_NOT_FOUND}
027 *
028 * <h2>Common Causes</h2>
029 *
030 * <ul>
031 *   <li>Misspelled city name (e.g., "Pariss" instead of "Paris")
032 *   <li>Ambiguous city names without country specification
033 *   <li>Very small towns or villages not in the database
034 *   <li>Special characters or numbers in city names
035 *   <li>Historical or deprecated city names
036 * </ul>
037 *
038 * <h2>Recovery Actions</h2>
039 *
040 * <ul>
041 *   <li>Check spelling and try alternative spellings
042 *   <li>Include country code with city name (e.g., "Paris,FR")
043 *   <li>Try nearby major cities as alternatives
044 *   <li>Use coordinates (latitude/longitude) instead of city names
045 *   <li>Implement a city suggestion system using fuzzy matching
046 * </ul>
047 *
048 * <h2>Usage Examples</h2>
049 *
050 * <h3>Handling City Not Found</h3>
051 *
052 * <pre>
053 * try {
054 *     WeatherData weather = sdk.getWeather("Atlantis");
055 * } catch (CityNotFoundException e) {
056 *     logger.warn("City not found: {}", e.getMessage());
057 *
058 *     // Suggest alternatives
059 *     List{@code <String>} suggestions = getCitySuggestions("Atlantis");
060 *     if (!suggestions.isEmpty()) {
061 *         logger.info("Did you mean: {}", String.join(", ", suggestions));
062 *     }
063 * }
064 * </pre>
065 *
066 * <h3>City Name Normalization</h3>
067 *
068 * <pre>
069 * public Optional{@code <WeatherData>} getWeatherForNormalizedCity(String cityName) {
070 *     String normalized = normalizeCityName(cityName);
071 *
072 *   try {
073 *     return Optional.of(sdk.getWeather(normalized));
074 *   } catch (CityNotFoundException e) {
075 *     // Try with country code
076 *     String withCountry = normalizeCityName(cityName + ",US");
077 *     try {
078 *       return Optional.of(sdk.getWeather(withCountry));
079 *     } catch (CityNotFoundException e2) {
080 *       return Optional.empty();
081 *     }
082 *   }
083 * }
084 * </pre>
085 *
086 * @since 1.0.0
087 * @see com.weather.sdk.WeatherSDK#getWeather(String)
088 * @see com.weather.sdk.exception.WeatherSDKException
089 */
090public class CityNotFoundException extends WeatherSDKException {
091
092  /** Serial version UID for serialization compatibility. */
093  private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
094
095  /** Error code for city not found issues. */
096  public static final String CITY_NOT_FOUND = "CITY_NOT_FOUND";
097
098  /** The city name that was searched for. */
099  private final String searchedCity;
100
101  /**
102   * Constructs a new CityNotFoundException with the specified message.
103   *
104   * @param message the detail message explaining why the city was not found. Must not be null.
105   * @throws NullPointerException if message is null
106   */
107  public CityNotFoundException(final String message) {
108    super(CITY_NOT_FOUND, message);
109    this.searchedCity = null;
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Constructs a new CityNotFoundException with the specified message and searched city.
114   *
115   * @param message the detail message explaining why the city was not found. Must not be null.
116   * @param searchedCity the city name that was searched for. May be null.
117   * @throws NullPointerException if message is null
118   */
119  public CityNotFoundException(final String message, final String searchedCity) {
120    super(CITY_NOT_FOUND, message);
121    this.searchedCity = searchedCity;
122  }
123
124  /**
125   * Constructs a new CityNotFoundException with the specified message, searched city, and cause.
126   *
127   * @param message the detail message explaining why the city was not found. Must not be null.
128   * @param searchedCity the city name that was searched for. May be null.
129   * @param cause the underlying cause of the city not being found. May be null.
130   * @throws NullPointerException if message is null
131   */
132  public CityNotFoundException(
133      final String message, final String searchedCity, final Throwable cause) {
134    super(CITY_NOT_FOUND, message, cause);
135    this.searchedCity = searchedCity;
136  }
137
138  /**
139   * Returns the city name that was searched for.
140   *
141   * @return the searched city name, or null if not provided
142   */
143  public String getSearchedCity() {
144    return searchedCity;
145  }
146
147  /**
148   * Returns a detailed message including the searched city name.
149   *
150   * @return a detailed error message
151   */
152  @Override
153  public String getMessage() {
154    final String result;
155    if (searchedCity != null && !super.getMessage().contains(searchedCity)) {
156      result = String.format("City '%s' not found: %s", searchedCity, super.getMessage());
157    } else {
158      result = super.getMessage();
159    }
160    return result;
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Returns the exception type description.
165   *
166   * @return "City Not Found Error"
167   */
168  @Override
169  public String getExceptionType() {
170    return "City Not Found Error";
171  }
172}
